lessons.title: Hebrew Letters
lessons.description: There are 22 Hebrew Letters, plus 4 final letters. Additionally, certain letters appear with a dagesh that changes its sound. Those letters are known as begadkefat letters. You may also see the dagesh on any other letter to indicate emphasis.

lessons.title: Hebrew Vowels
lessons.description: Here are a sample of common vowels you may see.

lessons.title: Hoda'ah: Full Text - Easy Mode
lessons.description: The הוֹדאָה ("thanksgiving") blessing is the next-to-last blessing of the Amidah. In it, we thank God for our many blessings, and we recognize and acknowledge that God is One alone in creating and making possible life's goodness. Because we are expressing our gratitude to God, in many congregations we bow respectfully both at the start and at the end of the Hoda'ah blessing.

lessons.title: Hoda'ah: Full Text - Hard Mode
lessons.description: The הוֹדאָה ("thanksgiving") blessing is the next-to-last blessing of the Amidah. In it, we thank God for our many blessings, and we recognize and acknowledge that God is One alone in creating and making possible life's goodness. Because we are expressing our gratitude to God, in many congregations we bow respectfully both at the start and at the end of the Hoda'ah blessing.

material.question: וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵינוּ וְאִמּוֹתֵינוּ
material.translation: and the God of our fathers and mothers

material.question: וּנְסַפֵּר תְּהִלָּתֶךָ
material.translation: and we will tell of Your praises

material.question: יִתְבָּרַךְ וְיִתְרוֹמַם שִׁמְךָ
material.translation: Your name will be praised and exalted

material.question: וּלְךָ נָאֶה לְהוֹדוֹת
material.translation: and to whom we give thanks

lessons.title: Birkat Shalom - Shalom Rav
lessons.description: The idea of peace is so important that the final blessing of the Amida is a prayer for peace - בִּרְכַּת שָׁלוֹם

material.question: וְטוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ
material.translation: and it is good in your eyes

lessons.title: Sim Shalom
lessons.description: In this prayer we ask God to inspire us to make peace and to act kindly towards others

lessons.title: Oseh Shalom
lessons.description: This prayer is said immediately after the Amidah and asks God to make peace in our lives and in our world.

lessons.title: Lecha Dodi - Letters and Vowels
lessons.description: In this prayer we greet Shabbat as if it were a bride or queen -- radiant and beautiful. Let's look at the simple letters and vowels that make up this prayer.

lessons.description: In this prayer we greet Shabbat as if it were a bride or queen -- radiant and beautiful. Let's look at the words that make up this prayer

lessons.title: The Four Questions - Full Words
lessons.description: One of the main focal points of the traditional Passover seder is the maggid, the telling of the story of the Exodus from Egypt. This story begins with the youngest person at the seder asking the Four Questions (Mah Nishtanah). These questions provide the impetus for telling why this night is different from all other nights.
lessons.prompt: can you sound this word out?

lessons.title: Ha Lachma Anya - Full Words
lessons.description: Ha Lachma Anya "This is the bread of affliction") is a declaration that is recited at the beginning of the Magid portion of the Passover Seder. Written in Aramaic, the recitation serves as the first explanation of the purpose of the matzo during the Seder.
lessons.prompt: can you sound this word out?

lessons.title: Hatikva
lessons.description: a 19th-century Jewish poem and the national anthem of the state of Israel.
lessons.prompt: can you sound this word out?

lessons.title: V'shamru
lessons.description: V'shamru is said before the Amidah during the friday night service. In reciting it, we declare that we are guarding Shabbat because it is God's special creation -- and we remember that by celebrating Shabbat we are strengthening our ties to God.
